## Description {#details}

Various options to control the behavior of getObjectSize.

## Enumerations

### enum class  {#a77eec32ab6be9e75a4b1f7cd5c4e5b8e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>enum class llvm::ObjectSizeOpts::Mode : uint8&#95;t</>}
 labels = {["strong"]}>
Controls how we handle conditional statements with unknown conditions.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a77eec32ab6be9e75a4b1f7cd5c4e5b8eadefd13f9ab5c5bd023984cbb0dac7109" />
<EnumerationListItem name="ExactSizeFromOffset">
All branches must be known and have the same size, starting from the offset, to be merged
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a77eec32ab6be9e75a4b1f7cd5c4e5b8ea10113250545a1816e8c19f41c98467d2" />
<EnumerationListItem name="ExactUnderlyingSizeAndOffset">
All branches must be known and have the same underlying size and offset to be merged
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a77eec32ab6be9e75a4b1f7cd5c4e5b8ea78d811e98514cd165dda532286610fd2" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Min">
Evaluate all branches of an unknown condition
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a77eec32ab6be9e75a4b1f7cd5c4e5b8ea6a061313d22e51e0f25b7cd4dc065233" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Max">
Same as Min, except we pick the maximum size of all of the branches
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

### NullIsUnknownSize {#a0229c5396522e5a903a277fda4c3659c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::ObjectSizeOpts::NullIsUnknownSize = false">
If this is true, null pointers in address space 0 will be treated as though they can&#39;t be evaluated.

Otherwise, null is always considered to point to a 0 byte region of memory.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorybuiltins-h/#l00162">162</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorybuiltins-h">MemoryBuiltins.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RoundToAlign {#a53a625d57d29696ca5cc6dd7a5ee94ee}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::ObjectSizeOpts::RoundToAlign = false">
Whether to round the result up to the alignment of allocas, byval arguments, and global variables.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorybuiltins-h/#l00158">158</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorybuiltins-h">MemoryBuiltins.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
